keyFindings: Most events are actually Information Sessions or Research Presentations
Current categories don't reflect the academic/research focus of events
Multi-theme events are common and need better categorization

Workshop.reasoning: Current "Workshop" events are mostly info sessions about programs/resources

Conference.reasoning: Events labeled as "Conference" are actually program info sessions

Meetup / Mixer.reasoning: Mix of networking events and program information sessions

Panel Discussion.reasoning: Some are actual panels, others are research-focused presentations

Hackathon.reasoning: Good alignment, but could be more specific about innovation focus

phase1: Update category definitions to match content analysis
Create new category structure with primary categories + themes
Implement multi-category support (max 2 categories per event)
phase2: Re-categorize existing events based on content analysis
Update AI categorization logic to use new categories
Test and validate new categorization system
phase3: Gather user feedback on new categories

immediate: Replace "Conference" with "Information Session" for program info events
Replace "Workshop" with "Educational Workshop" or "Information Session" based on content
Split "Meetup / Mixer" into "Networking Event" and "Information Session"
Keep "Panel Discussion" and "Hackathon" as they align well with content
longTerm: Implement theme-based tagging system (Research, Technology, Business, etc.)
Develop content-based auto-categorization using the new structure

sampleRecategorizations.title: Dundee Lunch & Learn
sampleRecategorizations.reasoning: Content focuses on Research, Business, Technology, Health/Biotech, Innovation, Education, Networking. Current categorization (Workshop) doesn't reflect the informational/educational nature. Suggested categories (Innovation/Entrepreneurship, Information Session) better align with the event's purpose and content.
